52.2: From when do we turn over the beds?
52.3: Our Rabbis taught: Formerly, they were wont to serve drinks in a house of mourning, the rich in
52.4: white glass vessels and the poor in coloured glass, and the poor felt shamed: they instituted therefore
52.5: that all should serve drinks in coloured glass, out of deference to the poor. Formerly they were
52.6: wont to uncover the face of the rich and cover the face of the poor, because their faces turned livid in
52.7: years of drought and the poor felt shamed; they therefore instituted that everybody's face should be
52.8: covered, out of deference for the poor.38 Formerly. they were wont to bring out the rich [for burial]
52.9: on a dargesh39 aid the poor
